snippet: In a new system to retain young talent, about 476 teachers received sizable bonuses this year, with 235 of them getting unusually large pay raises.
abstract: District of Columbia Public Schools gave sizable bonuses to 476 of its 3,600 educators, with 235 of them getting unusually large pay raises; bonuses and raises are part of city's merit pay system for public school teachers, which many experts say is the most advanced in the nation.
lead_paragraph: In a new system to retain young talent, about 476 teachers received sizable bonuses this year, with 235 of them getting unusually large pay raises.

headline.seo: Big Pay Days in Washington D.C. Schools’ Merit System
headline.main: In Washington, Large Rewards in Teacher Pay
headline.print_headline: In Washington, Large Rewards In Teacher Pay
